items.title: QA Engineer at Brave Software () (allows remote)
items.content:
QA Engineer

Equity
Brave Software

Job Description

Brave is looking for an Android­ focused QA Engineer to work on our latest Chromium­ based  Android browser.  While primarily testing the Android browser, the candidate would also test the laptop browser and provide support to end-users. This is a high­ profile and impactful, hands­-on position in an early stage startup.

We are remote-friendly, candidates must be authorized to work in the USA or Canada.

Skills & Requirements

  • 3+ years experience with manual QA and automation
  • Proficient with Java and/or a scripting language
  • Experience with test frameworks
  • Experience with desktop and mobile testing(Android preferred)
  • Android Studio and/or Eclipse IDE experience
  • Experience with software development via distributed development teams
  • Comfortable working in an open source setting
  • A passion for helping protect users’ privacy and security
  • Written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Proven record of getting things done

About Brave Software

The web has become a different place. With the ad­tech ecosystem out of control, users have  revolted and blocking ads has become the new weapon of choice for improving their browsing  speed, safety and privacy. Unfortunately, blocking alone results in a race to the bottom where  nobody wins. Without the ability for content creators to earn money for their efforts, users could  be left with fewer sites to browse, relegated to hand­picked content from controlled sources. 

Brave aims to transform the online ad ecosystem with micropayments and a new revenue sharing solution ​to give users and publishers a better deal, where fast, safe browsing is the path to a brighter future for the open web.

items.title: QA Engineer at ARGO Trade Solutions (Berlin, Deutschland) (allows remote)
items.content:
QA Engineer

€25k - 45k
ARGO Trade Solutions

Job Description

Ever dreamed of disrupting an entire industry?

Join ARGO and change the way companies participate in international trade!

Have you ever wondered how Western companies sell goods to countries such as China or Tansania for hundred thousands of Euros without fear of never being paid? We help them do it!

ARGO is building a new way to take the risk of non-payment out of international trade transactions, helping companies paying when its best for them. We make global transactions as easy as PayPal made it for consumers to buy in the dangerous world wide web.

We have just started on our big vision! We are backed by one of the best European VCs, we have a great complimentary management team and are right in the middle of building our first product.

But now its time for us to get help. We are looking for experienced quality assurance (QA) champions that share our vision of creating a big disruption and want to build something exciting and fresh from the ground up!

As core member of our backend team, you will help to ...

  • write and own test cases for our backend and frontend features
  • perform acceptance testing for every new feature
  • hunt for bugs and always advocate for covering even the edgiest of edge cases
  • create a plan for automated functional testing using Selenium
  • write specs and issues for developers on milestone planning phase

Both in Berlin as well as in a remote position, we offer you...

  • a small team of super smart and driven people that believe in changing things to the better 
  • an informal working atmosphere based upon direct communication and feedback with no bureaucracy or unnecessary disturbance: we believe in Slack, limited meetings and fast honest talk
  • direct influence on anything we build: We know what we want to do, but if you know a better solution, we will go your way!
  • an environment to grow: learn from your team, help others around you getting better every day, visit conferences, get and give feedback regularly and understand more than just the technical side of our business
  • lots of additional perks such as awesome team events, regular team lunches and dinners, free of choice hardware,...

We hope to find in you...

  • more than two years of experience testing applications
  • experience in analyzing business requirements, creating test plans and scripts
  • desire to conduct all types of testing (functional, load, acceptance)
  • attention to detail and zeal to get to the heart of the problem during testing
  • passion to manage test processes and implement new methodologies
  • ability to work in a multicultural team

 We are super excited to hear from you!

items.title: Quality Nonsense Ltd: Freelance Writers at WhoIsHostingThis.com
items.content:
Contract

(Anywhere)

We’re looking for reliable, talented freelance writers who love writing about technical subjects.

You’ll be writing on everything from web hosting to antique programming languages, from internet law to the social impact of encryption.

And you’ll be working as part of a pool of talented writers producing 10,000s of words of content per week to be published on WhoIsHostingThis.com, a site that reaches many millions of users every year.

About WhoIsHostingThis

WhoIsHostingThis.com is one of the worlds most popular web hosting sites. We’ve been featured in The New York Times, Time, Mashable, Daily Mail, VentureBeat, and many more publications in dozens of countries.

Who Works For us?

We work with a remote team of contractors in dozens of countries all over the world: from Bosnia to the UK to Canada to Australia. We continue to grow at a fast rate, and are looking for more writers to add to our team to keep up the pace.

What’s It Like Writing for Us?

The work is highly varied, but there is always writing work available for our team of freelance writers.

One writer might produce a profle of a hosting company on Monday, an introduction to the C# programming language on Wednesday, and a blog post about people falling in love with chatbots on Friday.

If that mix sounds exciting, rather than terrifying, then maybe you are the right type of writer to join our team.

Our CEO is a former writer/editor, and understands the value of quality content.

Job Requirements

Our team of writers is varied. We have a grumpy physics PhD, an idealistic MBA with a side hustle in Hollywood, and a hyperactive former greyhound racing gambler (or so he says).

We have wonderful writers that have worked for some of the world’s biggest websites. And we have exceptional people who only write for us.

We aren’t looking for clones. But everyone who works for us shares a handful of key attributes:

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills
    (US English, although you can be based anywhere);
  • Exceptional online research skills;
  • Some degree of technical proficiency
    (eg, two of our writers can code, most run websites/blogs)
  • Well organized & rock steady reliable;
    (ie, deadlines get met on our team)
  • Working knowledge of HTML and WordPress

    • (Just the basics, nothing fancy.)

  • How Do We Work?

    You’ll be working as part of our remote team located in dozens of countries around thw world. We use a few common tools to make that work:-
    • Gmail
    • Google Docs
    • Asana
    • WordPress
    • Skype
    • Slack

    What’s a Typical Project Like?

    We do a lot of different work. Check out our website, especially the blog and resources sections.

    • We are especially interested in people who can tackle very technical subjects, like resources on programming languages. A good example of this is our resource on the Forth programming language.

    Articles are often 1000+ words (and we even have one 60,000 word FAQ!). We are very clear on what we want on every project.

    Most articles can be researched online. However, some will require expert interviews via Skype or phone (we’ll cover costs).

    Workload

    We have as much work as you can handle. We have freelance writers producing as much as 10,000 words per week. We are looking for writers available of a minimum of one day/week, due to the overhead of managing many writers.

    We don’t micro-manage. We provide projects with descriptions including due dates and required length. There is sometimes communication back and forth (Asana is great for this).

    But mostly, you write the article and turn it in, we edit it and publish. Writers invoice every other week, and get paid in US dollars by PayPal or wire transfer.

    Apply: Please send an email to jobs@qualitynonsense.com with:-- A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit;- Three URLs showcasing your work related to the internet or technology.- Format your subject line as follows: Your Name | Freelance Writer Example: Baza Naidoo | Freelance WriterGood luck!

items.title: Software Quality Engineer Wine
items.content:
In the great Northwest they call it an SDET.  Other places they call it a Software Quality Engineer. Whatever they call it, it's you.  You've somehow found yourself writing code that tests other people's code.


At Granbury we respect the mighty SQE and we'll need your help making sure wine lovers around the world can have wine delivered to their doorsteps.  And no, that isn't a joke.  You'll use a new front end test automation tool we've built on top of Selenium WebDriver to make sure our DtC wine software works flawlessly.


Like Wes Mantooth, the other developers may hate you for it, but they will respect you.


And they'll work with you.  When you need DOM elements to have id's, they will give you id's.  You won't have to slog your way through with unwieldy xpath expressions.  You won't be a second class citizen and you'll get the respect and support you need.  No code ships without a green bar from you.


And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.  We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical conference or an in person design confab.

items.title: QA Engineer
items.content:
Springboard Retail has built a powerful and easy to use web based retail management platform for multi-channel specialty retailers. At 1,000 sites across North America innovative retailers are leveraging Springboard to operate their businesses more efficiently and profitably than ever before possible. As the leading specialty retail cloud platform, Springboard Retail has a rapidly growing customer base across many retail verticals including apparel, footwear, gifts, accessories, sporting goods, hobbies, toys, museums, nutrition, pet, and jewelry. We work hard and care deeply about our customers’ success. And we’re pleased to be able to say our customers love us!


We are passionately interested in how our customers interface with our products and platform, and in this dynamic market, our goal is to delight them with the best experience every single day. Because Springboard is the lifeline to a retailer’s operation, quality assurance of our product is imperative.


Springboard Retail is looking for someone to own QA for the Springboard Retail platform. In this position, you will engage directly with the engineering and product teams to ensure Springboard consistently delivers the highest quality service. You will report directly to the CTO.


Responsibilities:



  • Become a Springboard Retail product expert

  • Working with the product and engineering teams to understand requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria and to translate into detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases for multiple products

  • Enhance automated and manual testing infrastructure and draft product release deliverables consistent with established standards, methodologies, and best practices

  • Performing automated and manual testing of web applications, APIs, and web-based user experiences

  • Performing automated and manual testing of data analysis code, database queries, and data pipelines

  • Building our overall testing strategy, in collaboration with engineering and product team leaders

  • Evangelizing and cultivating the adoption of quality assurance best practices across the team

  • Estimating, prioritizing, planning, coordinating, and tracking testing activities

  • Participate in agile working practices such as daily scrum meetings, sprint planning, backlog grooming and retrospectives

  • Work on hardware simulation tools to allow automating manual tests

  • Manage and create key metrics to drive towards overall business goals and support critical decision making

  • Ability to manage multiple projects while meeting tight deadlines

items.title: QA Analyst
items.content:
Modern TribeÃ¢Â Â s QA team works on a lot of cool projects: over the past year alone, weÃ¢Â Â ve tested sites built by our dev team for big-name clients including Columbia Law School, Bon Appetit Magazine, Eventbright Academy Blog, Harvard Law School and What Should We Do (WSWD). (Want to see how we did? The links above highlight some of our work). And thatÃ¢Â Â s not even including our family of WordPress plugins led by The Events Calendar.

WeÃ¢Â Â ve got a slew of cool projects we are working on from now through early 2017, and need another member for our QA team. If working on high-profile sites for large clients gets you excited and a serious case of attention to detail is your jam, we should talk.

Personal Competencies

  • Extremely outgoing and friendly attitude
  • Strong communication skills
  • Experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented
  • Strong organizational skills
  • A methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Fluent English speaker

Knowledge and Experience

  • Has a proven track record in Quality Assurance.
  • Pays meticulous attention to detail + fights for the customer. Being able to catch bugs is huge, but it isnÃ¢Â Â t everything Ã¢Â Â QA is most effective when it puts itself in the customer or end userÃ¢Â Â s shoes.
  • Knows WordPress well, youÃ¢Â Â ll be expected to prove your familiarity with the platform.
  • Excellent verbal, non-verbal and written communication skills
  • Has 1+ year remote freelancing experience.

Bonus Points

  • Familiarity setting up local WordPress environments + cloning GIT repositories locally
  • Skills at training others how to admin complex WordPress sites/projects
  • Experience writing and implementing automated testing processes

Responsibilities

QA is responsible for ensuring all aspects of quality at Modern Tribe. ItÃ¢Â Â s a tall order for sure: learning how a site works, creating test plans covering obscure use cases, and then putting it all into practice when testing every aspect of site functionalityÃ¢Â Â¦itÃ¢Â Â s a lot of ground to cover. But weÃ¢Â Â ve got an established workflow down that helps make sure weÃ¢Â Â re setting the team up with the tools they need to proceed and succeed.

Though every project is different, hereÃ¢Â Â s the gist of our QA flow:

  • KICKOFF MEETING. - Just a kickoff Ã¢Â Â meet the PM; get your questions answered; set expectations; and schedule milestones.
  • PREPARING DOCS. - Getting started with internal documentation early is hugely important to getting the project into your brain.
  • REVIEW APPROVED COMPS. - Before you start QA or even get a walkthrough, youÃ¢Â Â ll review the comps to understand the project + prepare a list of questions to ask on the QA walkthrough.
  • QA WALKTHROUGH. - Once development is far enough along for QA to begin, youÃ¢Â Â ll do a walkthrough with the lead developer to get an overview of the functionality.
  • PREPARE QA CHECKLIST + TEST PLAN. - After seeing each component of the site in action, youÃ¢Â Â ll put together a first draft at a comprehensive QA checklist and a higher-level overview of what youÃ¢Â Â re planning to test, in what order, and when.
  • HEAVY DUTY TESTING. - YouÃ¢Â Â ll put the site through its paces and give it a few rounds of full pass bug hunting. Beyond just hitting buttons, youÃ¢Â Â ll be thinking from a higher level: are there usability concerns? Does what weÃ¢Â Â re doing here actually make sense as the best way to solve the problem? etc.
  • CELEBRATING A SUCCESSFUL LAUNCH. What feels better than kicking back after a successful launch? If QA has done their job, the project will launch smoothly, the team will have a finished product to show off, and Ã¢Â Â most importantly Ã¢Â Â the client will be happy. It doesnÃ¢Â Â t get much better than that.

* Our QA team also generally leads client training and prepares training documentation/videos when appropriate, so be prepared for some direct client communication.

Location

Work from anywhere in the US or Canada; if you are in Central or South America, letÃ¢Â Â s talk. This will be a 100% remote position. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY if your working hours are in a timezone outside of the US range as our team will not be able to support those working hours (weÃ¢Â Â ve tried, itÃ¢Â Â s just too hard).

Compensation

Our hourly rate for this gig starts at $30-$40/hr, depending on experience, with opportunities for rate bumps on annual review. This gig is about 6 hours per week of work to start and ramping up to about 15 -20 hours over the next 3 -4 months. This is a one time contract position, though we are always seeking longer relationships with kick-ass people.

Perks

We believe that distributed working is a way of life. We understand what it means to work remotely. We offer consistency in expectations, payment, and support. We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us. Also, if you work enough hours, we will invite you to go an adventure to attend our annual team trip.

To apply: http://tri.be/careers/qa-analyst/

items.title: Test Automation Engineer - ~The Perfectionist~
items.content:
*Test Automation Engineer*
*_~The Perfectionist~_*
Shoreditch, London
Salary + Equity

*Curve is growing - join our adventurous startup!*
We believe that the next generation of banking will be a single mobile platform that enables payment anywhere with any card from any account, and connects people in a simple way with the best technologies and financial offers - putting them back in control of their finances.

Our team of award winning (voted leading startup at the EPAwards ‘16 and included in Tech City’s Upscale ‘17 startup programme) entrepreneurs, product-builders and customer-focused marketers are developing a ground-breaking product with the customer at the core. To start with, we’ve taken the humble bank card and injected it with a whole load of innovation. Technical complexity, scalability, security and real-time transactions are all part of the day-to-day challenges; the future will include machine learning & big data.

With funding from the Who’s Who in angel investors and an experienced and ambitious founding team, we are at the forefront of London FinTech.

If you like to be intellectually stretched, your capabilities tested and want an opportunity to have a real voice, input and impactful contribution, then we’re offering that in abundance.

*_You bring your expertise; we’ll give you the platform to flex your talent!_*

*Role Objective:*

Quality Assurance plays an important role in the product development. As The Perfectionist you will be expected to help ensuring the reliability of the product. We expect you to think differently, smarter, so you can dream up all the test cases, specially those edge cases that no one can see until we start getting bug reports from our users.
Have you thought about how fast money moves around the world? And, how fast technology is changing the world?
Can you imagine how challenging is being responsible to ensure the quality of a revolutionary product that is bringing these two worlds together? Are you ready to ensure the product matches its requirements (functional, design, UX, etc…) and bring great ideas on how to make it even more valuable for our users?

*Is this You?*
* Motivated to set high standards.
* Able to execute your role swiftly and safely in rapidly changing environments.
* Revel in fast paced startup environments.
* Willingness to learn.
* Passionate about user experience.
* Keen to use your technical knowledge, expertise and ability with the aim of building an exceptional product.
* Comfortable with starting from a blank page and taking responsibility for defining, designing & developing clear, concise detail oriented test plans/cases from specifications or verbal communications.
* Clear communicator (written and verbal).
* Excellent Degree in Computer Science or related field.

*We’re looking for you to:*
* Identify test requirements from specifications, map test case requirements and design test coverage plan.
* Develop, document and maintain functional test cases and other test artifacts like the test data, data validation, harness scripts and automated scripts.
* Execute and evaluate automated test cases and report test results.
* Hold and facilitate test plan/case reviews with cross-functional team members - DevOps, Marketing, Product & Design.
* Have experience with iOS & Android functional and UI testing tools.
* Ensure that validated deliverables meet functional and design specifications and requirements.
* Isolate, replicate, and report defects and verify defect fixes. Escalate any potential quality issues to management in a timely manner.
* Creatively and intelligently solve technical problems.
* Ability to translate technical requirements into comprehensible test plans.
* Working experience with issue/bug tracking tools, ideally JIRA.
* Be focused on deadlines and deliverables – an ability to quickly find the defects and bugs.
* Have an inquisitive mind - You are always asking how does it work? Why? What if this happens?
* Abstract thinker – an ability to not conform to the norm. Norms do not find bugs quickly!
* Build a strong quality mindset around the team. It’s going to be Quality First!

*We live in an agile era, it’s a plus if you come with experience of:*
* Working in an Agile Development environment; preferably SCRUM.
* Acceptance Testing and how it applies to Agile Testing.
* Working with agile processes, including Test Driven Development.

*Robots are the future and so are we!*
We love automation here and we hope to automate as many regression tests as possible, therefore we expect you to either have willingness to learn how to automate tests (support in your development will be provided, you won’t be on your own),

*Or you have:*
A good level of proficiency with one or more programming/scripting languages.
Experience with automation frameworks like Selenium, Appium, Capybara or Espresso.
Experience working with test automation throughout the Software Development Life Cycle.
Familiar with Continuous Integration tools is a plus.

*About us*
We’re a team of circa 30, who work closely together to turn dreams and ideas into actions and product innovation. With a flat hierarchy and an ability to make decisions quickly, we’re based in a great office in Shoreditch, close to Old Street – the heart of the vibrant tech centre of London.

Our user base is growing daily and we have exceptional user retention. We have funding from the leading names in tech investment, and a founder who wants everyone who joins this remarkable adventure, to have the autonomy to exercise and develop their expertise.

*Our Recruitment Philosophy & Hiring Principles:*
We’re committed to building a product that people want, and we can’t do it without having a talented team with a meaningful stake in the business. Everyone who joins us and contributes to Curve’s success is rewarded with equity.

The more talent we have the more we can collectively accomplish - so we support and assist each other to reach and surpass what we think we are capable of.

*How we aim to look after you*
* Monthly health & wellbeing budget for gym, etc.
* If you work late, we make sure you have supper and a taxi home
* Team Lunch Fridays
* Infinite stream of fruit & snacks and great coffee
* Generous holiday allowance

*Start a conversation:*
By sending us as much information as possible about You, your achievements, your philosophy & ambitions and why Curve is of interest to you.

*And by answering this question:* - In an Automated world, how relevant is Manual Testing? And why?

_The successful applicant will be required to undertake DBS checks in accordance with regulation._

items.title: QA Analyst
items.content:
Who we are

Altus Group is a leading provider of software, data solutions, and independent advisory services to the global commercial real estate industry. Our businesses, Altus Analytics and Altus Expert Services, empower clients to analyze, gain market insight and recognize value on their real estate investments. Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,300 employees around the world, with operations in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific.

The opportunity

We are looking for a QA Analyst to join our team of functional testers on our Voyanta product. Someone who is a self-starter, methodical, and detail oriented; someone who can ensure the little things won’t get missed. In fact, we want someone who focuses on the minutiae. A QA manual tester who enjoys focusing on specifics features, considering all the variations that are going to occur in the data and testing for that.

This is a QA role for someone who enjoys working with big data sets in a MySQL database. We need a QA Analyst who both loves to work in Agile and yet is flexible to adapting methodologies and introducing new techniques to ensure the best work is being done in the most timely manner. Someone who is accountable, and constantly researching, tweaking, and testing.

This is a manual QA tester role, with an opportunity to dig deep and broaden your skills. If you are in a QA role within an enterprise organization, this is a chance to move into a start-up environment, and gain exposure to automation testing, business analyst work, and product development. Someone who enjoys working in small teams, at a fast-pace, in one week sprints; jumping from discussions with product managers to developers. Someone with outstanding communication, and a go-get-it-done attitude.

If you want to have your voice heard, strengthen your manual testing skills, learn automation, and customize your own career at a growing company, this is the QA Analyst opportunity to consider.

Here’s what our QA Analyst will do:

- Actively participate in weekly meetings; set and meet weekly sprint deliverables.
Work across all areas of the system including financial reports, database, UI and Excel integration.
- Test newly developed features as well as regression testing the existing system to ensure a high quality of software.
- Analyze feature requirements and devise appropriate and thorough test plans.
- Calculate complex expected results for financial reports.
- Create and execute weekly test plans.
- Produce complex test data that reflects how our clients use the system. This involves developing a good understanding of the structure of property data and reporting.
- Undertake both manual and automated testing.
- Work alongside the development team and product management team to resolve all issues as efficiently as possible.
- Raise bugs and errors and communicate with developers to determine resolution.
- Work with product team for clarification on requirements and functionality.
- Conduct research, suggest solutions, and generally do whatever it takes.

Who are you?

- Someone who loves QA! You understand testing principles; and you know how to approach testing in a Java environment.
- Bonus points if you have a degree in Computer Science or Math.
- Nice to have, but not necessary is familiarity with Selenium, Webdriver, and Cucumber.
- Not intimidated by large data sets. Our system is a very large data management system. You have experience working with data centric applications systems and you are comfortable with MySQL (or similar technologies).
- Methodical, analytical, and detail oriented. You are a linear thinker; yet you are incredibly adept at thinking of all possible answers. Your passion for math and solutions serves you in considering all of the variations that could occur in data and testing for that.
- An outstanding communicator. You have superior communication skills. You are concise, on point, and effective. You know how to listen and how to be heard. You are able to communicate both user requirements and technical details clearly across the team.
- An innovative problem-solver. You are flexible, but process-focused and you know how to balance urgency with long-term payoff. You are on a continuous search for improvements. You are never in a panic but you know how to get work done quickly, and accurately. Integrity of test results is your priority.

Need any more reasons to want to work with us?

As we continue to grow, the possibilities for the people that join Altus Analytics are significant. From professional growth to innovation to collaboration we are committed to continuing to foster the right environment to help our people realize their full potential. We give our people the freedom and responsibility to take charge of their career path, bring new ideas to the forefront and work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients.

We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to spend time doing some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn.

items.title: Test Engineer
items.content:
The App Business is looking for a talented Test Engineer to help us build and evolve our testing strategy and test team across an exciting range of projects. We hire passionate, dedicated testers who love to explore and question every step of the software development lifecycle in an open environment.

Our ideal Test Engineer believes testing is a collaborative activity, and gets involved with feature development from day one. They contribute to the quality, robustness and reliability of the products we create, and will have the confidence to say “we can’t ship that” if these things are compromised.

At the App Business, we believe nothing should impede you from doing your best work. So, we’ve structured the company around this principle in order to give individuals the autonomy to make decisions, to encourage experimentation and to think big.

If you want to learn and grow in a supportive environment whilst doing your best work then you are just what we’re looking for.


You will be:

• A technical expert in helping to deliver quality software.

• Involved in innovating and defining how the product you build will work and function.

• Learning and collaborating within agile teams.

• Focused on new ideas to improve the development process and to keep The App Business ahead of the competition.

• An avid champion of exploratory and context driven testing techniques.


You must have:

• Experience in questioning and championing from a Testing perspective.

• The ability to become a subject matter expert for a product.

• Excellent experience of Behavioural Development.

• Rigour in different testing techniques, test design and test strategies.

• Awareness of cross-device, compatibility issues and the challenges they pose to quality.

• Experience of working in an Agile team.

• The ability and drive to work outside of your comfort zone.


It's nice if you have:

• Experience with a UI automation framework.

• Experience with API and Database testing.

• Exposure to and understanding of mobile network architecture and networking principles.

• Experience using build and version control tools such Gradle and GIT.

• Exposure to the larger Testing community.

• A university degree at 2:1 or above.


About the App Business

Founded in 2009, The App Business runs fast and lean, creating awesome products and services for ambitious clients ready to rethink their business around mobile-enabled users. Based in the heart of London’s thriving King’s Cross, we work in an environment built to help us - and our clients - excel. We invest heavily in this vision, placing the support and development of our teams, as well as our culture, at the heart of everything we do.

As a company, we know it is important to acknowledge the effort our people put in - which is why we have a great range of benefits in place, which increase as people grow and develop within TAB. It is one of the many ways we ensure we say thank you, and has lead to us ranking as 'Outstanding' in the independent Best Companies Index.

If this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, apply now!

items.title: QA Analyst
items.content:
Ever wanted to help build and improve a product that actually helps people do useful things? Here at Memrise we’re building the world’s most joyful language learning app, and you could be a part of it! We already have well over 15 million users, loads of accolades like Google Play App of the Year 2015 and 2016, as well as Self-Improvement App of 2016, and we have massive plans to scale and improve online and mobile learning for everyone.

We are looking for an experienced QA Analyst to join our established team and help us take the product to the next level.

This opportunity presents the rare chance to join a startup as it scales from millions to tens of millions of active users, and in doing so make a meaningful impact on how people learn around the world.
REQUIREMENTS

Ideally you will be someone who is well versed in testing online products, mobile apps in particular. If you have knowledge of automated testing all the better, and you get many bonus points for being interested in languages and learning, as well as being bilingual or a polyglot.

You should have some or all of the following:



Solid commercial experience in a testing role
Excellent logic and problem solving abilities, meticulous attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to produce documentation and collaborate with others
Good understanding of testing methodologies including UAT, system, integration and regression testing
Experience in testing within an agile environment (SCRUM)
Experience in the use of test management and defect tracking tools
Experience in testing mobile or web-based applications
Demonstrate a basic level of technical awareness and an understanding of mobile/web application architectures
Ability to communicate with various stakeholders (both technical and non-technical)
Ability to work well within a team setting
Excellent logic and problem solving abilities, meticulous attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to produce documentation and collaborate with others


If you aren’t completely confident that you fit our exact criteria, please get in touch immediately. Humility is a wonderful thing and we’re not interested in hiring ‘rockstars’ or ‘ninjas’. And we're at least as interested in character as in talent.
BENEFITS

Fresh fruit; coffee and soft drinks. We keep you fuelled with a wide ever-changing variety of healthy and unhealthy snacks, breakfast materials and weekly team lunches. We have frequent team expeditions, the last one being a lovely canal cruise in the summer sunshine! We run a cycle to work scheme and a selection of useful perks and benefits. You'll get to work the people in this video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wORv8J1n0y8

items.title: Product Quality Assurance Manager
items.content:
We are a fast-growing technology company that offer an innovative B2B Customer Experience SaaS solution. We work primarily with the enterprise retail market, but also have clients in: health care, local government, hospitality and entertainment/leisure. We work with significant global brands, including O2, Telefonica global and House of Fraser.

We are growing our energetic and ambitious team, and looking for individuals who are driven, dynamic and keen to make an impact within a small business. We value people with a high-growth mind-set and innovative vision, individuals who are also analytical in their approach and keen to learn and be challenged.
We offer an innovative and growing web-based SaaS platform as well as natives tablet/smartphone apps for android, iOS and Windows.

We are hiring an experienced Quality Assurance Manager to join our growing team of 14 developers, developer operations and User Interface designers. You will report to our CTO/Co-Founder and work with our CEO/Co-Founder managing the product, you will also manage a junior QA executive.
The ideal candidate will be analytical, thorough and will have strong values for quality, innovation and fantastic user experience. You will be looking to progress within the company into a Senior QA or a Product Business Analyst role.

Responsible for monitoring general performance and UX of our SaaS product and reporting issues to development
Track and manage issues and bugs within the system and communicating with relevant teams around delivery
Define test strategy and write test plans
Facilitate proactive solutions by collecting and analysing quality data
Implement new testing processes, plans and programs
Overseeing the complete end stage of product delivery to production servers (innovating the process in delivery), including:
Reviewing and completing Jira tickets waiting for QA
Checking the product works against the original scope and making notes against the original scope of any deviations to discuss with the product & development team
Testing bugs and issues and managing the developer team through completing them alongside our required release plans
Providing user experience feedback to generally improve the product
Test the product against a variety of use cases
Develop, write and execute user stories, test cases
Devising and performing test automation projects and supporting the development team in building up a complete test automation suite. Currently using Selenium, Protractor, JUnit with a Bamboo CI
Perform stress and load test scenarios with our CTO and Dev Ops team
Working with the CTO to finalise release functionality
Providing image content and brief overviews on the new functionality for sales and training packs and training the project management teams on how new functionality works
Writing engaging release notes (with imagery) for our web and apps and packs for internal and client use
Becoming a team member who fully understands the product to be able to help advise team members with questions
Where required, attending scoping sessions to discuss requirements and use cases
Involved in product backlog grooming process to discuss completion of issues and upcoming needs


*Minimum Qualifications:*
* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Maths or other related field
* 2+ years of QA testing and test automation
* Strong organisational skills with attention to detail and the ability to multi task
* Strong verbal communication skills

*Desired Qualifications:*
* Proven knowledge of software design, SDLC, software requirements documentation
* Strong understanding of SCRUM, Agile and other development methodologies

items.title: QA Superstar
items.content:
BookingBug is the industry’s most advanced, powerful and versatile appointment and event booking platform, and one of London’s fastest growing technology start-ups. Using a combination of cutting-edge front end technologies, and a truly open and scalable cloud-based API architecture, we’re able to design solutions that can accommodate the wildest of client requirements. As technology progresses, so do we; re-architecting and expanding our platform to take advantage of new ideas, methodologies, and the latest and greatest trends in the technology industry.

It’s an exciting time to join BookingBug. We’re enhancing our testing landscape and looking for a dedicated QA [or quality focused software guru] to join one of our project teams (affectionately named after video games). The BookingBug platform is built on an interesting tech stack and the product roadmap is constantly in a state of flux. It’s all forward thinking in an exciting time.

About the role
Based in our London HQ, you’ll be working across a range of internal and client projects - including a growing list of major UK and US brands. The QA crowd work together with corresponding folk, utilising common tools and techniques to find out what the development and project management teams may not before the end user does, with added evidence and supporting metrics.

In the role, you will:
● Use your knowledge of enterprise testing to help us develop our QA processes
● Work with development, engineering and project teams to produce quality, tested features
● Contribute to the release cycle by monitoring quality on all environments
● Plan testing from early design and specification stages to ensure robust implementation
● Create test cases, modify existing tests and record and document unplanned exploratory tests
● Maintain JIRA and help to school other team members on defect etiquette
● Produce reports and maintain document hygiene in our JIRA, WIKI and google doc repos
● Show initiative and out of the box thinking when discussing unexpected paradigms
● Support clients and BookingBug staff by training and sharing techniques and information

About You
The role requires the following skills and experience as a minimum:
● Understanding of contemporary web development processes and release cycles
● Knowledge of core web tech (HTML, CSS, JS, and relevant frameworks)
● JIRA, git, Gherkin, TestRail or contemporaries
● Test planning, test reporting, test metrics, sprint management, exploratory testing, mobile testing, documentation
● Excellent skills with office suites; experience of process development, reports, writing plans & test cases, feature scoping, enterprise-level documentation
● Dedication to technical issues; solving (and creating) in creative ways
● A tester’s outlook on new functionality and a QA’s desire to maintain quality
● Talent in translating code/ techspeak/ jargon into human readable instructions and vice versa
● Computer science fundamentals are a plus
● Bug tracking, version tracking, release tracking, tickets (JIRA, Git, Zendesk, etc.) a must
● Relevant test certifications / qualifications strongly desirable
● Experience of working with teams to help develop & streamline test processes
● A confident, enthusiastic attitude and an understanding of and enthusiasm for, small company culture and dynamics
● All relevant business or educational experience taken into consideration

This is a unique opportunity to join a company that has the stability and commercial success of a big business, but the heart & soul of a start-up. Our Dev teams are working on truly interesting challenges – engineering issues, scalability, latency, distributed systems… so we need someone who is motivated by problem solving & seeing the wider impacts of their work. If this sounds like you we’d love to hear from you! We’re based in Farringdon in a dynamic, fun office, and have international offices in Boston and Sydney as well. Our team is very diverse, with backgrounds spanning from astrophysics to criminology to music management, and we pride ourselves on our great working culture.

items.title: CareMessage (YC W14) | QA Automation Engineer | REMOTE | Full Time | http://caremessage.org
items.content:
CareMessage (YC W14) | QA Automation Engineer | REMOTE | Full Time | http://caremessage.org

CareMessage is looking for a QA Automation Engineer to help with manual and automated quality assurance of the CareMessage web application and API. You will be responsible for entire features and will be a full member of the CareMessage Engineering team. Our team believes in an Agile development environment, test driven development. Our tools of choice are Ruby on Rails, AngularJS, PostgreSQL, and we place an emphasis on open collaboration and ownership. We're using Protractor for automated frontend testing so knowledge in that is a plus. When something isn’t working, we’re not afraid to throw it out and try something new - so if you have exciting ideas about the QA process and how to make your own job even easier, you’ll fit right in. All of our developers and QA engineers are working from a remote location.

Apply here: http://grnh.se/lt3wim

items.title: Automation QA Engineer
items.content:
*QA Engineer*

We're a tech business that's growing fast. We develop deal comparison SaaS for triple play: TV, Phone and Broadband. It's a complex industry - with over 5000 products available - so we're here to make it a little bit easier to choose the right option. Not only that, we recently developed an app to help people save on their energy bills called Voltz . It's had phenomenal feedback on the app store (4+ stars)

*A few of our awards include:*

- One of Europe's fastest growing technology businesses in the 2013 GP Bullhound Media Momentum Awards

- In 2016 we were acquired by Dixons Carphone

_Sounds good? Apply and let's chat._

items.title: Junior QA Engineer
items.content:
Hi, recruiter! If you're reading this and looking to work with us please go through the document on our careers page (it's on every job advert). Thanks!

ABOUT URBAN MASSAGE

We're very proud to be a fast growing start-up making our mark on the well-being industry. Our world-class platform enables brilliantly talented therapists to provide caring treatments to customers wherever and whenever they want a well deserved treat. In the past 2 years we've launched in 3 international locations, provide over 7,000 massages a month. We're now looking at many other international locations this year and a range of different wellness services.
As a team, we're just under 50 global employees. We do all we can to make our work environment one we love, can be ourselves in, and can be really successful in. This means lots of working and playing hard (at our Friday drinks and socials) and a chilled office full of ping-pong tables, free yoga classes and pets. Our roles come with a lot of responsibility and empowerment - we like to employ brilliant people and give them the freedom to achieve brilliant things. You can find more passionate detail about working here on Glassdoor - or just ask us!

THE ROLE

As a Junior QA Engineer you would be focused on supporting the Product team. We're working hard to take our product to the next stage as our start-up expands in the UK and internationally so it's a really exciting time to join us and be part of that experience!
Our product team presently has 12 highly-skilled employees working across design/engineering and testing. You'd work closely with other multi-discipline engineers. Our fast-moving team bring together strategy, creative and technology in agile programmes of work. We embrace strong development standards, TDD, continuous integration, peer review, test automation and replicable deployment processes.
Within this role, you'd be encouraged to explore new technologies where good business value is evident. We currently have several applications that are supported on multiple platforms - Web, Mobile (iOS and Android). We'd like you to be comfortable testing on all of these.
Currently, we have a highly experienced QA lead leading all of the testing + release process within the Product team. As a quality driven team, we have identified a need for additional resource to ensure we continue to deliver stable, well tested work to our users. Your day-to-day work will report into this thought-leader, who has a wealth of knowledge to help you upskill throughout your career with us.
We'd like for you to come with experience in this space already and the drive to draw on it to make a brilliant impact.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet consumers needs
Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product owner) to identify system requirements
Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

REQUIREMENTS

We expect our Engineers to have experience in:
Knowledge of QA concepts
Strong organization, analytic and problem-solving skills with great attention to detail.
Familiarity with Bug tracking (such as Jira) and version control system (Github) is preferred.
Picking up new technologies when appropriate for the task in hand
We also expect you to genuinely enjoy your craft, to take initiative, and want to help do things better

BENEFITS

Competitive salary (based on experience)
Join a fast-growing and exciting start-up with excellent growth opportunities
Working with a fun, international and highly-motivated team where there's never a dull moment!
Well-speced Apple hardware
A generous conference and training budget
Free weekly yoga sessions
Discounts on at-home massages
Fully stocked fridges
Central London office with great transport links
